bug.author: bee-san
bug.summary: Ciphey returns plaintext for all decimal based input
bug.description:
‚ö†Ô∏èIMPORTANT‚ö†Ô∏è if you do not fill this out, we will automatically delete your issue. We will not help anyone that cannot fill out this template.
Have you read our Wiki page "Common Issues & Their Solutions"?
Describe the bug ‚ûú ciphey -t "941241298794216421426424464515" Result '941241298794216421426424464515' (y/N): Result '515464424624124612497892142149' (y/N): This passes JSON checker. Plaintext ‚ö†Ô∏èIMPORTANT‚ö†Ô∏è The below code is non-negotiable for "Ciphey didn't decrypt...." problems. If you do not tell us your plaintext, we will not help you. <denchmark-code>Unknown, it was found on r/codes </denchmark-code>
Version ‚ö†Ô∏èIMPORTANT‚ö†Ô∏è We need this information because different environments will induce different bugs in Ciphey
OS/Distro: Linux Python version: 3.8.5 Ciphey versions: 3.5 Did you use Docker? No
Run Ciphey with and paste the results into <denchmark-link:https://pastebin.com>Pastebin.com</denchmark-link> or a <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/>GitHub Gist</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/bee-san/36545aea21bc023bfcf63da60d776a97>https://gist.github.com/bee-san/36545aea21bc023bfcf63da60d776a97</denchmark-link>
To Reproduce <denchmark-code>ciphey -t "941241298794216421426424464515" -vvv </denchmark-code>
Expected behavior Ciphey does not return the plaintext (the user should know its not plaintext if they are using Ciphey)

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.85. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/Ciphey/Ciphey>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
This is because any string (but not a string, an int) of numbers will always pass the JSON checker. ToDo: Make sure the output contains something other than pure numbers.
We should consider using orjson as it's apparently 4 times faster than json: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ijl/orjson#performance>https://github.com/ijl/orjson#performance</denchmark-link>
